In neurobiology, which neurotransmitter is primarily involved in the reward system of the brain?
A. Glutamate
B. Dopamine
C. Serotonin
D. GABA
E. None of the above

Dopamine is the neurotransmitter primarily involved in the reward system of the brain. It plays a crucial role in reinforcing behaviors that are beneficial for survival, such as eating and reproduction, by producing feelings of pleasure and satisfaction. This system is also implicated in addiction, as drugs can hijack the reward pathway, leading to compulsive drug-seeking behavior.
